meanings.definition: To give a wrong title to.
meanings.sent1: She mistitled the book as 'The Adventures of a Cat' instead of 'The Adventures of a Dog'.
meanings.sent2: The librarian mistitled the magazine as 'National Geographic' when it was actually 'Time'.
meanings.sent3: The teacher mistitled the student's drawing as a horse when it was clearly a dinosaur.
meanings.sent4: The chef mistitled the dish as 'Spicy Chicken' when it tasted more like 'Mild Tofu'.
meanings.sent5: The museum curator mistitled the painting, causing confusion among the visitors.

meanings.sent1: The mistitled document led to confusion among the team members.
meanings.sent2: The mistitled file was lost in the sea of paperwork on the desk.
meanings.sent3: The mistitled movie poster featured the wrong actors' names, creating a humorous mix-up.
meanings.sent4: The mistitled book cover caught the attention of readers for all the wrong reasons.
meanings.sent5: The mistitled song became a hit for its unintentional irony.
